filmography.title: The Big Broadcast
filmography.role_description: A charismatic radio crooner who races against time to save a failing radio station; Crosby's first starring feature film role.
filmography.plot: A radio singer who is perpetually late for his broadcasts must rally to save the station from bankruptcy.

filmography.title: She Loves Me Not
filmography.role_description: A Princeton student who hides a cabaret dancer in his dorm room to protect her from gangsters, causing a campus scandal.
filmography.plot: A cabaret dancer witnesses a murder and hides out in a Princeton University dorm room with the help of a student.

filmography.title: Mississippi
filmography.role_description: A pacifist who is branded a coward but finds fame as a singing riverboat captain under the tutelage of W.C. Fields.
filmography.plot: A young man disgraced for refusing a duel joins a riverboat troupe and gains a reputation as a crack shot.

filmography.title: Anything Goes
filmography.role_description: A young man who stows away on an ocean liner to pursue the woman he loves, getting mixed up with a gangster and a nightclub singer.
filmography.plot: A young man falls in love with a beautiful woman and follows her onto a luxury liner, where he discovers she is an English heiress.

filmography.title: Pennies from Heaven
filmography.role_description: A wandering troubadour who befriends a young orphan girl and her grandfather, trying to save them from the welfare authorities.
filmography.plot: A drifter promises a condemned murderer he will look after the man's daughter, leading to a struggle with the welfare department.

filmography.title: Waikiki Wedding
filmography.role_description: A press agent in Hawaii who stages a publicity stunt that turns into real romance with a contest winner.
filmography.plot: A pineapple company publicist must keep a beauty contest winner happy in Hawaii so she will endorse their product.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Sweet Leilani')

filmography.title: Rhythm on the River
filmography.role_description: A talented songwriter who ghostwrites for a famous composer and falls for a fellow ghostwriter.
filmography.plot: Two ghostwriters for a famous composer meet and fall in love, unaware they are working for the same man.

filmography.title: Road to Singapore
filmography.role_description: The wealthy son of a shipping magnate who flees his engagement to travel the South Seas with his best friend.
filmography.plot: Two playboys try to escape marriage and work by heading to Singapore, but they end up fighting over the same woman.

filmography.title: Road to Zanzibar
filmography.role_description: A sideshow promoter who travels across Africa with his partner, getting involved in diamond mines and safaris.
filmography.plot: Two carnival performers get stranded in Africa and are duped into funding a safari to find a diamond mine.

filmography.title: Birth of the Blues
filmography.role_description: A clarinet player in New Orleans who forms a band to play a new style of music called 'jazz'.
filmography.plot: A clarinet player in New Orleans creates a Dixieland band, facing prejudice as he tries to popularize blues music.

filmography.title: Holiday Inn
filmography.role_description: A singer who retires from show business to open an inn that is only open on holidays, introducing the song 'White Christmas'.
filmography.plot: At an inn which is open only on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('White Christmas')

filmography.title: Road to Morocco
filmography.role_description: A survivor of a shipwreck who inadvertently sells his friend into slavery in Morocco, leading to a chaotic rescue mission.
filmography.plot: Two castaways wash up on the shores of Morocco and get involved with an Arabian princess and a desert sheik.

filmography.title: Going My Way
filmography.role_description: A progressive, crooning young priest who is sent to revitalize an aging parish, winning over the strict elder pastor.
filmography.plot: A young priest arrives at a failing New York parish and conflicts with the established, old-fashioned pastor while winning over the youth.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
filmography.role_description: Father O'Malley returns to help a nun save her inner-city school from closure, engaging in a friendly rivalry.
filmography.plot: A priest and a nun at a Catholic school have different ideas on how to run the parish, but work together to save it from being condemned.

filmography.title: Road to Utopia
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville performer who goes to the Klondike for gold and mistakenly steals the deed to a mine.
filmography.plot: Two vaudeville performers assume the identities of bad guys in the Klondike gold rush to find a gold mine.

filmography.title: Blue Skies
filmography.role_description: A carefree song-and-dance man who opens and closes nightclubs while competing with his friend for the same woman.
filmography.plot: A dancer and a singer compete for the love of a beautiful showgirl over the course of several years.

filmography.title: Road to Rio
filmography.role_description: A musician who stows away on a ship to Brazil and helps a woman escape a hypnotist's control.
filmography.plot: Two musicians stow away on a ship to Rio de Janeiro and help a woman who is being hypnotized into an unwanted marriage.

filmography.title: The Emperor Waltz
filmography.role_description: An American phonograph salesman in 1901 Austria who tries to sell a machine to Emperor Franz Joseph while wooing a countess.
filmography.plot: An American salesman tries to sell a phonograph to Emperor Franz Joseph of Austria and falls in love with a countess.

filmography.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
filmography.role_description: A mechanic who is knocked unconscious and wakes up in Camelot, where he uses modern technology to astound the knights.
filmography.plot: A mechanic is transported back in time to 528 A.D., where he befriends Sir Sagramore and brings modern technology to King Arthur's court.

filmography.title: Here Comes the Groom
filmography.role_description: A reporter who must get married within five days to adopt two war orphans he brought back from France.
filmography.plot: A reporter has to find a bride in five days in order to keep the two orphans he adopted.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('In the Cool, Cool, Cool of the Evening')

filmography.title: Road to Bali
filmography.role_description: A vaudevillian who dives for sunken treasure in Bali while competing with his partner for a princess.
filmography.plot: Two song-and-dance men leave Australia for Bali to work as divers and find themselves competing for a princess's affection.

filmography.title: Little Boy Lost
filmography.role_description: A war correspondent who returns to post-war France to search for his son, who went missing during the war.
filmography.plot: A war correspondent returns to France after WWII to find the son he lost during the war.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: White Christmas
filmography.role_description: A famous song-and-dance man who teams up with a sister act to save his former general's failing Vermont inn.
filmography.plot: A successful song-and-dance team become romantically involved with a sister act and team up to save the failing inn of their former commanding general.

filmography.title: The Country Girl
filmography.role_description: A washed-up, alcoholic actor who is given a second chance at a career, delivering a powerful dramatic performance.
filmography.plot: A director hires an alcoholic actor for a new musical, but the actor's wife becomes the target of the director's suspicion and eventual affection.

filmography.title: High Society
filmography.role_description: A popular jazz musician who tries to win back his ex-wife before she marries another man.
filmography.plot: A spoiled heiress is planning to marry a stuffy man, but her ex-husband arrives to win her back.

filmography.title: Man on Fire
filmography.role_description: A wealthy businessman who engages in a bitter custody battle for his son, showing a rare unsympathetic side.
filmography.plot: A businessman fights his ex-wife for custody of their son, believing he is the only one capable of raising him.

filmography.title: The Road to Hong Kong
filmography.role_description: An aging vaudevillian who gets mixed up in international espionage and space travel in the final 'Road' film.
filmography.plot: Bob Hope and Bing Crosby return as con men who get involved in a spy plot involving a secret formula for rocket fuel.

filmography.title: Robin and the 7 Hoods
filmography.role_description: The eloquence secretary of a Chicago charitable organization who gets caught up with a group of Prohibition-era gangsters.
filmography.plot: A Chicago gangster tries to maintain his territory against a rival while becoming a philanthropic hero to the public.

filmography.title: Stagecoach
filmography.role_description: A drunken doctor who finds redemption while traveling on a dangerous stagecoach journey through Apache territory.
filmography.plot: A group of disparate passengers on a stagecoach are threatened by Indian attacks.
